---

# ispconfig_pgsql_database (Resource)

Manages a PostgreSQL database in ISP Config. The database engine is always `postgresql` â€” use `ispconfig_mysql_database` for MySQL databases.

## Example Usage

```terraform
resource "ispconfig_pgsql_database" "example" {
  database_name    = "myapp_db"
  parent_domain_id = 1
  active           = true
  quota            = 500
}
```

<!-- schema generated by tfplugindocs -->
## Schema

### Required

- `database_name` (String) The PostgreSQL database name.
- `parent_domain_id` (Number) The parent domain ID.

### Optional

- `active` (Boolean) Whether the database is active. Defaults to `true`.
- `client_id` (Number) The ISP Config client ID.
- `database_user_id` (Number) The database user ID.
- `quota` (Number) Database quota in MB.
- `server_id` (Number) The server ID.

### Read-Only

- `id` (Number) The ID of the database.

## Import

Import an existing PostgreSQL database by its numeric ISP Config ID:

```shell
terraform import ispconfig_pgsql_database.example 42
```
